title: Exergyn sets new boundaries in solid-state refrigerant technology - PR Newswire
summary: Exergyn, a technology firm backed by Mercuria and Lacerta, has developed solid-state cooling technology using shape memory alloys (SMAs) that is environmentally friendly and efficient. This technology can replace hydrofluorocarbon (HFC) refrigerants, which are potent greenhouse gases, and has the potential to revolutionize the heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and refrigeration (HVACR) industry. Exergyn's SMA solid state cores are zero Global Warming Potential (GWP), non-toxic, non-flammable, cannot leak, and open up new possibilities for leaps forward in energy efficiency and clean cooling.

title: Navien announces first HVAC product during virtual launch event - Supply House Times
summary: Navien announced three new innovations during a virtual launch event: the NPF Hydro-furnace, their first HVAC product; the NHW-A non-condensing tankless water heater, and the NHB-H condensing boiler. The NPF Hydro-furnace is a high-efficiency furnace that uses Navien's industry-proven dual stainless steel heat exchangers to heat water in an isolated compartment out of the airstream. The NHW-A non-condensing tankless water heater features the patented ComfortFlow recirculation pump and buffer tank originally introduced in the NPE-A condensing tankless water heater. The NHB-H condensing boiler is an update to the widely popular NHB, and includes new advancements such as the Vent Installation Detector (VID) for enhanced safety and an advanced front panel controller with an intuitive multi-line LCD display.
green_innovation: TRUE - Navien's NPF Hydro-furnace is a high-efficiency furnace that uses Navien's industry-proven dual stainless steel heat exchangers to heat water in an isolated compartment out of the airstream, which provides sound-reduction and energy efficiency.
business_innovation: TRUE - Navien's NHW-A non-condensing tankless water heater features the patented ComfortFlow recirculation pump and buffer tank originally introduced in the NPE-A condensing tankless water heater. ComfortFlow helps eliminate the 'cold water sandwich' effect and resolves the issue of low flow rates found in other tankless water heaters. It also reduces the wait time for hot water by allowing internal or external recirculation without the need for external parts or controls.

title: Lessons from Energy Crisis Due to the War in Ukraine | BCG - BCG
summary: The EU has managed to remain resilient through the first year of the war in Ukraine by investing in diversification of energy, keeping energy policy and strategy agile, enhancing energy security, and promoting energy efficiency.  The energy crisis has underscored the fact that energy will play a major geopolitical role and that further energy disruptions are likely to occur, making it imperative for policymakers, energy producers, and consumers to learn from the lessons of the past year.  Actions taken by EU governments to reduce reliance on Russian natural gas included spending massively to acquire LNG on spot markets, leasing FSRUs, and restarting idle coal-fired power plants. These choices came at an environmental cost, with nations returning to coal and diesel-fueled power generation, and illustrate the often-hard tradeoffs that governments make between energy security and sustainability.  The EU's bold policy combined conservation, massive investment to diversify energy sources, and a willingness to temporarily veer from decades of energy strategy to tackle the crisis at hand. However, EU countries emerged from the winter of 2022–2023 with natural gas storage levels at their highest level in years, fuel prices back down to pre-invasion levels,1 1 Gas prices have, as of mid-August 2023, jumped again on the potential for strikes at Australian LNG export facilities. A strike could put 10% of global LNG supplies at risk. Notes: 1 Gas prices have, as of mid-August 2023, jumped again on the potential for strikes at Australian LNG export facilities. A strike could put 10% of global LNG supplies at risk. and an economic hit that was lighter than anticipated.

business_innovation: TRUE. The article describes a number of business innovations that were implemented by companies in response to the energy crisis, such as the use of FSRUs to import LNG and the repurposing of natural gas pipelines to carry hydrogen.
green_product: TRUE. The article does not describe a specific green product, but it does mention that the EU is investing in the development of clean-energy technologies and solutions, which would include green products.
green_process: TRUE. The article describes a number of green processes that were implemented by companies in response to the energy crisis, such as the use of more efficient boilers and the electrification of end uses that are currently fossil fuel powered.

Insulation for the roof, walls and floor is a cornerstone of energy-efficient building design. A well-insulated home reduces reliance on air conditioning and heating systems, cutting energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Danfoss India lines up $60 million capex plan - The Times of India
summary: Coal India Limited (CIL) is planning to invest around Rs 24,750 crore in environmentally friendly coal transportation projects. Danfoss India is planning to invest $50-60 million in capex to make new products in India.

title: New home energy management “ecosystem” lands, backed by solar heavyweight - One Step Off The Grid
summary: Maxeon Solar has launched SunPower One, a home energy management system that optimises solar and battery savings by monitoring and automating the use of household appliances, including scheduled electric vehicle charging. SunPower One includes residential solar panels, the SunPower Reserve storage system, the SunPower Drive EV charging solution, and a range of other energy services, all coordinated through an app that provides energy insights and recommendations to users. Maxeon will be showcasing SunPower One at the upcoming All-Energy Australian event in October.
green_innovation: TRUE, the SunPower One home energy management system contributes to environmental sustainability goals by optimising solar and battery savings, thereby reducing reliance on fossil fuels and promoting renewable energy.
business_innovation: TRUE, the SunPower One home energy management system is a new or improved business process that differs significantly from the firm's previous business processes and that has been brought into use in the firm. It includes greater efficacy, resource efficiency, reliability and resilience, affordability, convenience, and usability.
green_product: TRUE, the SunPower One home energy management system is a good or service that is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, the SunPower One home energy management system is a method or technique in manufacturing, production, or any other operational activity that minimises environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.
product_or_process: SunPower One home energy management system

title: 22 September 2023 - Calling all businesses and entrepreneurs in East Devon - Prosper is here to help! - East Devon - East Devon District Council
summary: Prosper is a new, free, business support programme aimed at helping businesses and entrepreneurs to achieve their business development ambitions. Specialised support offered through Prosper is designed to help businesses and entrepreneurs in East Devon, Exeter and Mid Devon to improve productivity, reach net zero goals, move into new markets, develop new products and more. The programme will provide a mixture of online support and in-person one-to-one sessions or workshops offering support with running a business, help to improve energy efficiency and become more environmentally sustainable, support to start a new business and, support for businesses looking to take on additional staff.
green_innovation: FALSE, The article describes business support for businesses to reach net zero goals, become more environmentally sustainable, and develop new products, but it does not provide details of specific innovations that meet the criteria to be green innovations.
business_innovation: TRUE, The article describes business support for businesses to improve productivity, move into new markets, develop new products and more. These are all examples of business innovations.
green_product: FALSE, The article does not describe any specific products that meet the criteria to be green products.
green_process: FALSE, The article does not describe any specific processes that meet the criteria to be green processes.
greenwashing: FALSE, The article does not describe any examples of greenwashing.

title: Stelrad launches Electric Series - a new range of electric radiators - Installer Online
summary: Stelrad has launched a range of electric radiators, its first venture into the electric marketplace. The range includes a dozen or so different models with a number of sizes of each model available, with standard radiators for any room along with a selection of towel rails specifically targeted at bathrooms and en-suites. The radiators in the Electric Series are aesthetically appealing and provide attractive options for the décor in the home and come with a five-year warranty on the heating parts and a two-year warranty on the electric components.

title: Sharp Consumer Brand Growing In OZ, New 5 in 1 Microwave With Air Fryer Coming – channelnews - ChannelNews
summary: Tempo, the Sydney-based distributor for Sharp consumer electronics, is experiencing double-digit growth following their acquisition of Sharp three years ago. The company credits the launch of new products, including a five-in-one microwave with air fryer, for their continued success. Sharp is also expanding its range of flatbed microwaves and is considering introducing additional Sharp products to the Australian market.
